metadata.Title: CVE-2018-0735 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The OpenSSL ECDSA signature algorithm has been shown to be vulnerable to a timing side channel attack. An attacker could use variations in the signing algorithm to recover the private key. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0j (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0i). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1a (Affected 1.1.1).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.1.0g-2ubuntu4.3
openssl - 1.1.0g-2ubuntu4.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.1
openssl1.0 - 1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this may be introduced by the fix for CVE-2018-5407

criterions.comment: openssl package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.0g-2ubuntu4.3').
openssl1.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2n-1ubuntu5.1').
